input_text.Prompt:
Insurance portal Coverfox has partnered with Uber India as the broker on record for the ride hailing app's drivers. Coverfox will provide assistance in insurance policy purchases and facilitate car insurance solutions for Uber 's driver partners as part of the latter's re ward-oriented programme UberCLUB

"We recognise that our driver partners spend a considerable amount of time on the road and we want to ensure their over-all safety. This partnership will be useful for hundreds of thousands of driver partners on the Uber platform," said Bhavik Rathod, general manager south & west at Uber India.

The UberCLUB programme in India is an offshoot of Uber's global Momentum Rewards Program.Coverfox's car insurance services will initially be available in 11 cities, and will soon expand to all the cities Uber India operates in. Coverfox will use its existing insurance partners for Uber drivers across all categories and help negotiate rates for premiums.

"Our team has put together a well-knit network of experts, insurers and partners to facilitate insurance as well as claims," said Varun Dua, co-founder of Coverfox.

Uber will be able to get a significant discount on insurance rates via this partnership. "An Uber driver can get insurance at 30% discount to the market rate," Jaimit Doshi, chief sales and marketing officer at Coverfox, told ET. Coverfox, which handles 25,00030,000 policies per month across all verticals, expects the partnership with Uber alone to add the same number in 12 months.

The Accel and SAIF Partners backed insurance portal gets over 50% of its revenue from the motor insurance segment of which car business remains the bread and butter.

"Currently , we are servicing retail and commercial vehicles through Uber," said Doshi. If more opportunities come up, the company can expand partnerships with insurance companies, he said.

Dua said his company has clocked Rs 175 crore worth of premiums and is Rs 175 crore worth of premiums and is targeting Rs 400 crore by December 2017 -a large portion of which will be driven by Uber.

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A:
Coverfox, an Accel and SAIF Partners backed insurance portal, has recently partnered with Uber India as the broker on record for the ride hailing app's drivers. This strategic collaboration aims to provide assistance in insurance policy purchases and facilitate car insurance solutions for Uber's driver partners as part of the latter's reward-oriented program, UberCLUB. This partnership is an offshoot of Uber's global Momentum Rewards Program and is expected to offer significant discounts on insurance rates to Uber drivers.

Coverfox, with its existing insurance partners, will negotiate rates for premiums and utilize its well-knit network of experts, insurers, and partners to facilitate insurance as well as claims. This partnership is anticipated to add the same number of policies in the next 12 months, as Coverfox currently handles 25,000-30,000 policies per month across all verticals. The motor insurance segment, specifically car business, remains the bread and butter of Coverfox, generating over 50% of its revenue.

The co-founder of Coverfox, Varun Dua, expressed that this partnership will be useful for hundreds of thousands of driver partners on the Uber platform, emphasizing the importance of over-all safety for the drivers. Jaimit Doshi, chief sales and marketing officer at Coverfox, stated that Uber drivers can avail insurance at a 30% discount to the market rate.

This collaboration is poised to benefit both Coverfox and Uber India, with Coverfox anticipating a significant increase in revenue and Uber drivers experiencing reduced insurance rates. The partnership is expected to expand to all the cities that Uber India operates in, with Coverfox using its existing insurance partners to facilitate insurance for Uber drivers across all categories.

In summary, Coverfox and Uber India have formed a strategic partnership to provide insurance solutions for Uber's driver partners in India, offering significant discounts on insurance rates. This collaboration is expected to benefit both parties and expand to all cities operated by Uber India.

Coverfox expects the partnership to generate the same number of policies in 12 months as it currently handles per month across all verticals. The Accel and SAIF Partners-backed insurance portal generates over 50% of its revenue from the motor insurance segment, with car business remaining its bread and butter.

input_meta.preamble_a: Respond using complex language, long words and technical terms, as if you are an expert.

label_annotations.factors_a: Too much detail when a summary was required
